DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Relevance Osteosarcoma Excision Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to whether or not the lesions relevant to osteosarcoma were surgically removed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The relation of something to the matter at hand._A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults. It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites. It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus). Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs._The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: The relation of something to the matter at hand.:A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults. It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites. It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus). Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.:The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Concepts.definition: The relation of something to the matter at hand.

A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm, predominantly affecting adolescents and young adults. It usually involves bones and less frequently extraosseous sites. It often involves the long bones (particularly distal femur, proximal tibia, and proximal humerus). Pain with or without a palpable mass is the most frequent clinical symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
